page.title: 10WILDLIFE IN BLACKPARK
page.content: Just got back from Black Park.The first bird we saw was a Mallard duck,it is most common on lakes and reservoirs there was a whole flock of them.As we were walking round the lake we saw a Chaffinch in a dip by the road with it there was a House Sparrow,a Robin and a Dunnock.On the lake we saw a summer visitor the Canada Goose.After we saw those birds we went into the woods on the way we saw a Blue Tit.In the woods Steve said to me "Gareth look at this""Big wow"I said"But its a Gold Crest"(the smallast bird in the world).We stood for five minutes close enough to touch.Hope you have enjoyed this report. BY STEVE MANLEY & GARETH JONES
